document_data.mainbody:
Fumble, originally called Berthots blunder, was a common spell used by wizards.
When cast, creatures became clumsy within the spells area of effect. Items and weapons were dropped and a walking or running creature tripped and fell. Fallen creatures struggled to stand and picking up a fallen item or weapon became difficult. A caster could target a single creature as well.
In addition to verbal and somatic components, the spell required a material component a small amount of solidified fat from milk.
The spell was invented by the Netherese arcanist, Berthot, in .
